speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Karl, I guess you've got two choices.  Either you have the tattoo removed, or you travel the globe searching for another soul mate named Fredwina.  We'll be right back after this.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, I was just looking over this offer you got from the Siren Cruise Line.  They want to know if--

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, you know my policy on commercial endorsements.

speaker: Roz
text: Just listen.  One of their celebrity entertainers cancelled on a ship that's going to Alaska, and they'll let us both go for free if you'll fill in, and all you have to do is give a brief lecture--

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, I'm a psychiatrist, not a huckster! There are still some of us in this profession who believe in--[_sees brochure_] mahogany wainscoting?

speaker: Roz
text: Isn't that fabulous?  And just look at those staterooms!

speaker: Frasier
text: Wow...

speaker: Roz
text: Not to mention the gourmet chefs, the world-class health spa...

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it does sound awfully tempting, Roz, but I just don't think it's right to trade on one's good name for a free trip.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, plenty of people do.  Look, Zubin Mehta did one, General Schwartzkopf, and it says right here, Gore Vidal did two of them!

speaker: Frasier
text: Gore Vidal?  He hates everything!

speaker: Roz
text: But, if you feel it would tarnish your image, I'll just call Vicki and tell her you said no.

speaker: Frasier
text: Vicki?  Who's Vicki?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, she books the celebrities.  We met once at a party a long time ago, I'm surprised she remembered me.  Frasier, we're on in ten seconds.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, just hold on a minute, Roz, you didn't tell me this was a favor for a close friend.

speaker: Roz
text: She's not a close friend.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Roz, obviously this woman means something to you.  It's certainly an awkward position you've put me in.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, I don't care.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, I'll go!  But it's the last time I pull your chestnuts out of the fire! _He goes back into his booth.  Scene Two -- Frasier's Apartment It's afternoon, and pouring rain outside.  Frasier sits at the piano, playing idly.  Daphne comes out in her bathrobe. _

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hello, Daphne.  Little late in the day, isn't it?

speaker: Daphne
text: I just love days like this... nowhere to go, nothing to do... though I have this sneaking suspicion I've forgotten something.

speaker: Frasier
text: Like getting dressed?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_goes to the window_] Oh, I could watch the rain for hours. Of course, when I was a little girl, I hated the rain. Stuck inside, couldn't go out and play.  But my mum always said, "enjoy it while you can, there'll be no water in hell."  Of course, that was her answer for everything.  "Eat your veggies, there'll be no Brussels sprouts in hell... have a lie-down, there'll be no naps in hell..."

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, you know I am a therapist, if you'd like to talk about this sometime.

speaker: Daphne
text: About what?

speaker: Frasier
text: Nothing.

speaker: Daphne
text: I wish I could remember what it is I forgot to do.  Oh well, you know what they say -- if you can't remember, it probably wasn't important anyway.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh no!

speaker: Frasier
text: You are dripping!

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, that's what'll happen when you're standing out on the corner waiting for your ride!

speaker: Daphne
text: Mr. Crane, I am so sorry!

speaker: Martin
text: What the hell were you thinking?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Venting these emotions is all well and good, Dad, but I just had these floors waxed! _He takes Martin's coat, hands him a towel and rushes to lay down newspaper._

speaker: Martin
text: I said four o'clock on the corner of Second and Bell.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, you should have called me!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I was afraid if I went looking for a phone I'd miss you!

speaker: Frasier
text: Good point, Dad.  Now, could you just step on that, please? [_Eddie comes in_] Oh God, he's wet too!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no!  Damn him!  Daphne, help me get this canine sprinkler out of here!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh now, don't be too cross with him, Dr. Crane!  As my mum used to say, there'll be no dogs in hell!

speaker: Frasier
text: I sincerely doubt that! _Daphne takes Eddie to Martin's room.  The doorbell rings, and Frasier opens the door to Niles._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, I just stopped by to return your cookbook [_hands it over_], I won't be needing it after all.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, really?  I thought you were preparing an anniversary dinner for Maris.

speaker: Niles
text: Uh, not this year.  Maris has flown to Switzerland for a new cosmetic treatment.  Only one man performs the procedure, and Maris wants to see him before he's extradited.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, I'm so sorry.

speaker: Niles
text: It's so depressing.  Every time it looks as though we're approaching a breakthrough in our therapy, Maris runs off somewhere.  I really hoped spending time together on our anniversary would get us over the hump.

speaker: Frasier
text: Take heart, Niles, I know how frustrating it can be when someone puts their own selfishness ahead of your personal needs. [_steers Niles onto the newspaper_]

speaker: Martin
text: Niles, why don't you take off that wet coat and stay for dinner.  I'll get us started with a couple of nice hot toddies, just like we used to make down at Duke's.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Dad, there's a recipe in this book for a hot toddy.  It calls for courvoisier, chamomile tea, and a dash of framboise!

speaker: Martin
text: Garnish it with a few rose petals and that's just how Duke used to serve it.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Niles_] Make yourself comfortable. _In the kitchen, Martin pours water into three mugs and puts them in the microwave.  Frasier comes in._

speaker: Frasier
text: Poor Niles.  You know, Dad, maybe I should--

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, ah!  Stop right there, I know what you're going to say. You want to call Maris and talk her into spending her anniversary with Niles.

speaker: Frasier
text: I didn't realize I'd gotten as predictable as all that.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you have, and if you ask me--

speaker: Frasier
text: Stop right there.  I know exactly what you're going to say. You're going to say I should mind my own business and keep my big bazoo shut!

speaker: Martin
text: I was gonna say "fat yap," but you're in the ballpark.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I just think that when two people are having problems, their emotions can get the better of them.  A third party can provide some perspective.

speaker: Martin
text: They already have a therapist!  And if Niles needs any more help, he's got Dr. Jim Beam and he makes house calls! _Martin pours bourbon into the mugs and gives two to Frasier.  In the living room, Niles is talking on his cell phone._

speaker: Niles
text: I'm not trying to make you feel guilty, Maris.  I hope you enjoy your trip to Switzerland.  Actually, I have plans of my own for our anniversary that I'm very excited about. Mmm-hmm.  Bon voyage. [_hangs up_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's a very healthy approach, Niles.  What are your plans?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I thought I'd sit alone in my cavernous apartment while rocking back and forth while hugging my knees.

speaker: Martin
text: Now, Niles, you're not going to be alone on your anniversary, you'll have me and Fras.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually, Dad, I've agreed to give a lecture on a cruise that's going to Alaska... but I don't see any reason why you two shouldn't join me, why don't you?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, that'd be great!  Wouldn't it, Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Uh, I don't know.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, come on, Niles, it'll help get your mind off your troubles.

speaker: Niles
text: I appreciate your concern, but whisking me off on a cruise? I'm not as emotionally fragile as all that.

speaker: Frasier
text: As you wish.  Well, Dad, I guess it'll be just you and me then.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah!  When do we leave?

speaker: Frasier
text: Fourteenth.

speaker: Niles
text: [_breaking down_] The fourteenth? **SHIP OF FOOLS** _Scene Three -- Ship Hallway  Niles and Martin are walking through the hallway. Martin is imitating a ship foghorn. _

speaker: Martin
text: [_Makes the fog horn sound twice_]

speaker: Niles
text: You know, that just gets funnier and funnier each time you do it.

speaker: Martin
text: [_Makes the fog horn sound once_]

speaker: Niles
text: No, no I'm wrong _Niles and Martin exit while Frasier and Roz emerge from their staterooms at the same time._

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, some ship, huh?  How's your stateroom?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'd hardly call it a "stateroom."  Wouldn't even call it a room, but I don't know the nautical term for "broom closet with sconces."  How's yours?

speaker: Roz
text: [_shuts her door behind her_] The same.  Worse, even.  I'm sure you have a better view from your porthole than I do.

speaker: Frasier
text: You have a porthole?!

speaker: Roz
text: What's the difference?  A cabin's just a place to shower and change your clothes.

speaker: Frasier
text: You have a shower?!  All I have is a nozzle and a floor drain, it took me an hour before I put those two things together! _Roz leads him down the hall.  Scene Four - Cocktail Lounge Martin and Niles are sitting at the bar._

speaker: Martin
text: Now the buffets come at a pretty good clip, so you got to pace yourself.  And watch out for your fillers--your breads, your rolls, your chips and dip.  You've only got so much room, don't be a hero.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, guys!

speaker: Martin
text: Hey!  Hey, Fras, this is great!  You got one of those bedrooms where the bathroom turns into a shower?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Dad. [_to Niles_] And before you say anything, I had no idea what Spartan conditions we were in for.

speaker: Niles
text: It's quite all right.  Once I got over my fear that I'd be hauled below deck and manacled to another oarsman, I actually started to enjoy myself.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know, I guess I won't be spending that much time in my cabin anyway.  I'll be hobnobbing with my fellow celebrities.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, they got a lot of big names on board.  Did you see the pictures?

speaker: Roz
text: [_reading_] "Live and in Person: Radio star Dr. Frasier Crane!"  How about that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Lord, I don't know if I really care for the word "star," considering the caliber of the other people on board.

speaker: Niles
text: [_looking closer_] "The Comedy Stylings of Giggles O'Shea." Oh yes, you're in stellar company.  Oh, and look, they even managed to snare a magician--"The Amazing Lance Gould."

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, he's great!  I caught his act in Reno a few years ago. For his finale, he made his own head disappear!

speaker: Niles
text: Now, did the toupee go too, or did it just hover over the collar?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dear God!  You've booked me on a floating Gong Show!  What happened to Zubin Mehta and Gore Vidal?

speaker: Roz
text: I am so sorry, Frasier, I had no idea.  I guess they just booked all their A-list celebrities on the big ships.

speaker: Steward
text: [_on P.A._] Your attention, please.  The "Taste of Alaska" buffet is no being served on the Lido deck.

speaker: Martin
text: Ooh, that's my cue!  You guys coming?

speaker: Niles
text: Uh, Dad, we had a big lunch at home.

speaker: Martin
text: Rookie mistake.  See you at dinner.

speaker: Roz
text: Look, Frasier, it's not that bad.  I mean, at least you got top billing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, of course I got top billing!  I'm the only one up there I've ever heard of!

speaker: Roz
text: Come on, what about him?

speaker: Frasier
text: "Latin Singing Sensation Carlos 'the Barracuda' DelGato?"

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah!  Don't you remember him from the 70's?  He invented that big dance craze, the Barracuda.

speaker: Niles
text: Believe it or not, Maris was a big fan of his.

speaker: Frasier
text: No!

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, that was the one dance she could do.  The Hustle was too strenuous -- she had no booty to shake.  But her fetching little under-bite was just perfect for the Barracuda. _Niles sticks out his jaw and snaps his teeth in remembrance.  Frasier notices a well-dressed blond woman staring from across the lounge._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, why is that woman staring at you? _Niles turns, looks --and snaps back. _

speaker: Niles
text: God help me!  It's that awful Mimi Cosgrove from the country club!  Hide me!  She's a man-eating lush who'd go to any lengths to--

speaker: Mimi
text: [_coming over_] Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Mimi!  You funny little good-for-nothing Mimi! [_kisses her cheeks_] What are you doing here?

speaker: Mimi
text: Oh, just looking for the bar... oh, there it is! [_grabs his arm_] Let me buy you a cocktail.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, actually, I--

speaker: Mimi
text: I don't know what it is about being on the water that makes me so thirsty!  Ooh, have you been working out? _She drags him to a table.  He turns to Frasier and Roz and mouths, "Help Me!"  A swarthy Latin man in Toreador pants comes in._

speaker: Roz
text: Look, there he is, the Barracuda!

speaker: Frasier
text: How thrilling!  A fellow headliner on the _U.S.S. Has-Been_!

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, shut up!

speaker: Frasier
text: Come on, Roz, let's go over my notes for my lecture.

speaker: Barracuda
text: Dr. Frasier Crane?  I am Carlos DelGato.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_shakes his hand_] Ah, hello.  It's a pleasure to meet you. Oh, this is Roz Doyle. _Roz extends her hand.  The Barracuda snaps it up and starts kissing it._

speaker: Barracuda
text: _Buenos noches.  Habla espanol?_

speaker: Roz
text: Uh, not really.

speaker: Barracuda
text: Is no matter.  I am sure you are schooled in the... international language.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes, Roz, say something amusing in Esperanto!

speaker: Barracuda
text: [_nasal laugh_] You know, each night, I select the most beautiful woman in my audience and present to her a red rose.  That means the evening has just begun.  Perhaps one night, _chou_ will be... my _especial_ lady?  Until then... _He sticks out his jaw and snaps his teeth.  Roz gasps.  He struts off._

speaker: Roz
text: O.K., you're right.  We're on the Voyage of the Damned. _Niles and Mimi sit at a table.  As they talk, he's constantly pushing her hand off his wrist, his thigh, etc._

speaker: Mimi
text: So, are you still separated?

speaker: Niles
text: Uh, I'm afraid so.

speaker: Mimi
text: Oh, you poor thing.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, we're trying actually -- couples' therapy.

speaker: Mimi
text: Oh, good!  You know I've always thought the world of you and, uh...

speaker: Niles
text: Maris.

speaker: Mimi
text: Yeah, an angel!  Anyway, if there's ever anything I can do to be of comfort to you, [_leans over and nibbles his ear_] you just let me know.  Ooh, what is that marvelous fragrance?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, that's uh-- Waiter: Excuse me, sir, but the lady wanted to send you this, with her compliments.

speaker: Niles
text: What lady? Waiter: Over there, in the black dress and the veil?

speaker: Niles
text: Maris! Waiter: Oh, and there was one more thing.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes? _The waiter tosses the champagne in Niles's face.  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene Five -- Lounge _ Waiter: I'm really very sorry, sir, but she gave me the biggest tip I've ever seen.

speaker: Mimi
text: I'm sure you can convince Maris that this is all completely innocent--if not, I'm in Cabin 712.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, Niles, what happened?  Was that Maris I saw running out of here?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes!  She saw Mimi pawing me and assumed the worst!  I've got to go speak to her.  How upset did she look?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, I couldn't see anything past the outfit.  Who wears a black dress and veil on a cruise?

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, the woman has virtually no pigmentation!  Three minutes in the sun, she'd sear like an Ahi tuna!

speaker: Niles
text: She's supposed to be in Switzerland!  What's she doing here?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, I'm sorry.  This may be partly my fault.  You see, I called Maris, told her how upset you were, and said it might be fun if she could join us on the cruise.

speaker: Niles
text: You invited her to come and didn't tell me?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I thought it would be a nice surprise!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, well it worked out perfectly!  She's probably on the phone arranging to fly home from the next port. [_the waiter comes by_] Excuse me, excuse me.  The lady who sent me the champagne, do you happen to know which stateroom she's in? Waiter: No, sir.  But she did ask me to give you a message.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes?

speaker: Niles
text: Just out of curiosity, how much are these running her? _Scene Six -- Lounge Frasier sits at a table, preparing note cards for his speech.  Roz, wearing a cocktail dress, comes from the bar with two drinks. _

speaker: Roz
text: You're on in twenty minutes.  How's your speech coming?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's hard to concentrate.  I'm so concerned about Niles.

speaker: Roz
text: [_reads his first card and laughs_] I like this opening joke you wrote, it's very funny.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_chuckles_] Thank you.  I can't take all the credit, actually.  I had a patty melt with Giggles before his show.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles.  I can't tell you again how sorry I am for meddling.  How did it go with Maris?

speaker: Niles
text: Terribly.  This is, without a doubt, the most depressing night of my life.

speaker: Roz
text: That is so funny-- I'm sorry.

speaker: Niles
text: I spent hours looking for her, then I remembered her fondness for the Barracuda.  I ran down to the lounge, and found that Latin cheese ball crooning his ghastly song directly to her!  I started to make my way over, then a waiter came over, and by the time I got the champagne out of my eyes, she'd disappeared into the crowd.  I waited for her.  She never came out.  Neither did DelGato.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, what are you implying?

speaker: Niles
text: You know Maris's taste for revenge.  If she thinks I'm having an affair with Mimi, then she's going to try and punish me in kind.

speaker: Roz
text: Wow... do you really think she's planning to "do the Barracuda?"

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, don't jump to conclusions, that's exactly what Maris did.

speaker: Niles
text: Says a lot about our marriage, doesn't it?  No trust on either side, what hope is there for us?

speaker: Frasier
text: Is there anything I can do?

speaker: Niles
text: No, you've done enough.  I'm just going to take a walk.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I feel so guilty about this.  When will I learn to stop interfering in other peoples' affairs?  I'd better go talk to Maris, see if I can fix this.

speaker: Roz
text: You're gonna butt in again?

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't see what business that is of yours!

speaker: Roz
text: Here comes your dad.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no!  Oh, no!  If he finds out, I'll never hear the end of it!

speaker: Martin
text: Boy, that "Taste of Alaska" spread was a bust.  You want to know what caribou meat tastes like?  Not chicken!  Where's Niles?

speaker: Frasier
text: He's out on a walk... oh, I may as well tell you everything! Maris is on board.  She and Niles had a horrible fight, and their marriage is in worse shape than it's ever been before, and no need to tell you how she got here in the first place!

speaker: Martin
text: I know, I know, what was I thinking, inviting her to come on the cruise?

speaker: Roz
text: You invited Maris?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, well, Niles was so upset over being alone on his anniversary, it just seemed like a good idea.  Smart, huh? I give you all this guff about sticking your nose into other people's business, then I turn around and do the same damn thing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Dad, don't be too hard on yourself.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, all right!  I invited Maris too.

speaker: Martin
text: You did?  I thought I told you to keep your big bazoo shut!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, you're one to talk!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, so what do we do now?

speaker: Frasier
text: Nothing!  Nothing at all!  Just let them work things out themselves, and stay on the sidelines where we belong.

speaker: Martin
text: All right. [_checks watch_] Ooh, better get going, we're gonna miss the first seating for dinner!

speaker: Frasier
text: But Dad, my lecture's in fifteen minutes.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, jeez.  All right, guess I can't do everything.  Tell me how it went at the midnight buffet!

speaker: Roz
text: We'd better get going too.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.  First, I'm going to go talk to Maris.

speaker: Roz
text: You just said--

speaker: Frasier
text: Forget what I said!  You're coming too!

speaker: Roz
text: Why do you need me?  I don't even know her.

speaker: Frasier
text: You can vouch for Niles's innocence.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, all right.  I have to admit, I'm kind of curious to meet her.  You know, in all these years, I've never actually seen her face?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I haven't seen her most recent one, so this'll be a new experience for both of us. _Scene Seven -- Maris's Room Frasier and Roz stop in the hallway outside Maris's room. _

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, now let me do all the talking--oh, and if it looks like she has an orange Abyssinian on her head--_don't stare._ That's a wiglet. Maid: All through.  Have a nice evening.

speaker: Frasier
text: Damn!  She must not be here! [_Roz goes in_] Roz, what are you doing, you can't go in there!

speaker: Roz
text: I just want to see the room! _Frasier follows her into the room, which is spacious and lavishly decorated._

speaker: Frasier
text: You can't just barge into someone else's-- [_gasps_] My God, is that a grand piano?!

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, look!

speaker: Frasier
text: The Barracuda's calling card!  That means that he's chosen Maris to be his...

speaker: Frasier/Roz
text: "_Especial_ lady," eew!

speaker: Roz
text: Why are we hiding?  We came here to talk to her!

speaker: Frasier
text: Because it's impossible to extol the virtues of trust to someone whose room you've just broken into! _Someone comes through the door outside.  Frasier and Roz climb into the shower and draw the curtain._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear God!  The shower is bigger than my entire cabin!

speaker: Roz
text: Shut up!

speaker: Roz
text: Martin!

speaker: Martin
text: Ahh!  What are you two doing here?!

speaker: Frasier
text: We came to talk to Maris!  What are you doing here?!

speaker: Martin
text: The same as you!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, then why did you come in the bathroom?!

speaker: Martin
text: Well... what do you think?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, all right, fine.

speaker: Roz
text: Let's get the hell out of here.

speaker: Roz
text: It's Maris.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, what's the big deal, why don't we just go in there and talk to her?

speaker: Roz
text: We can't go in there now, she might not be alone.  Remember the rose?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, God.

speaker: Roz
text: I don't see her, maybe she went back out.  Oh, wait.  I see her coat on a hat rack.

speaker: Frasier
text: Look closer.  Is the hat rack moving?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh my God!

speaker: Martin
text: What's she doing?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, she seems to be alone.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's good.

speaker: Roz
text: Now she's pouring champagne -- two glasses.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's bad.

speaker: Roz
text: Now she's putting on music.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, oh, that's bad.  On so many levels.

speaker: Roz
text: She's coming this way! _Everyone crams into the shower, and they draw the curtain.  They stand quietly as Maris [_seen only as a silhouette_] comes in, gargles, spits, and goes out again. _

speaker: Frasier
text: She's gone!

speaker: Martin
text: How the hell are we going to get out of here?

speaker: Frasier
text: I have no idea.  All I know is that I have got to be downstairs in the next ten minutes, or two hundred people are going to be sorely disappointed!

speaker: Roz
text: Two hundred people?  Where'd you hear that?

speaker: Frasier
text: They told me that was the room capacity! [_Roz just looks at him_] Oh!  Oh, come on!  Giggles had to _add_ a show!

speaker: Martin
text: Shh, she's gonna hear us.

speaker: Roz
text: It's the Barracuda!

speaker: Martin
text: Who's the Barracuda?

speaker: Roz
text: He's a sleazy Latin lounge singer Maris is going to sleep with to get back at Niles for kissing Mimi!

speaker: Martin
text: Who's Mimi?

speaker: Frasier
text: A horny society boozer, and the Mrs. O'Leary's Cow of our current predicament!

speaker: Martin
text: Who's Mrs. O'Leary?

speaker: Frasier
text: A woman in Chicago who -- oh, I don't have the time!  The point is, we have got to stop this before Maris does something that is going to damage her relationship forever.

speaker: Roz
text: We cannot go out there.  We don't want to walk in on the two of them.

speaker: Martin
text: I don't want to see that!  I just ate caribou!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, all right.  Seems I'm the only one who cares about this relationship.  I will go and do it. _He opens the door -- and comes face-to-face with Niles.  Everyone jumps and yells. _

speaker: Niles
text: Maris, what a lovely bathroom!  Naaah! [_comes in and shuts the door_] What are you doing here?!

speaker: Frasier
text: We came to convince Maris that there was nothing going on between you and Mimi!  What are you doing here?!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, Maris and I ran into each other on deck, and we had a long talk, and, well, she invited me back here for a glass of champagne!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, that's great, Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, though it might marr the mood a bit if she finds you all spying on her! [_notices the sink_] Did you use that mouthwash?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Maris did.

speaker: Niles
text: My God -- she's in the mood for more than champagne!  You've got to leave right now.  Just give me time to see her out to the balcony.

speaker: Frasier
text: A balcony?!

speaker: Niles
text: Count to ten, and then scram, so Maris and I can celebrate the way a man and his wife were meant to. [_cracks the door_] Oh, damn.  She started without me.

speaker: Frasier/Martin/Roz
text: Eeww...

speaker: Niles
text: Drinking the champagne.
